entry.title: Avoid dangling reference to MigratableCreditCard in MigrateCardsRequest.
entry.content:
Currently, MigrateCardsRequest has a reference that can become dangling:

1) On construction, MigrateCardsRequest stores a reference to a vector

of MigratableCreditCard that is owned by the caller.

2) However, the caller is FormDataImporter and FormDataImporter's

lifetime is shorter than that of the MigrateCardsRequest: The former

gets destroyed before PaymentsClient

(the owner of MigrateCardsRequest) and the destruction order is

correct, because members of FormDataImporter assume that

PaymentClient outlives them.

3) Therefore, on destruction of AutofillClient (but potentially also

in other scenarios if FormDataImporter ever resets its members)

the reference that MigrateCardsRequest keeps, becomes invalid.



This CL changes MigrateCardsRequest to keep a copy instead.



However, this change triggered a few more build config changes:

- MigrateCardsRequest only exists on Desktop, but was previously

included for all OSes. However, MigratableCreditCard is not included

in the iOS and Android builds. As soon as one changes the member from

a reference to a vector to an actual vector, a forward declaration

is no longer enough.

- This CL therefore also excludes MigrateCardsRequest from iOS and

Android builds. This should slightly improve binary size (by ~2.7 KB)

at the cost of a few ifdefs.



Bug: 1468967

Change-Id: I83f7cec6a8abcfc1133292a7bf1d566f1a145d3f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753425

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Olivia Saul

entry.title: Revert "Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 68270ff9259076cd7bc9b398f88d4043166ee676.



Reason for revert: Likely the cause of crbug.com/1471415



Original change's description:

> Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer

>

> This CL:

> -Adds a mojom::AutofillFormAction enum denoting the browser autofill

> operation that sent a form to the renderer.

> -Adds an ApplyAutofillAction function to form_util with intent to merge

> the two deleted functions.

> -Adapts FillFormField and PreviewFormField and ClearPreviewedElements

> to handle both Fill and Undo operations.

> -Fixes typos and clang warnings in touched files

>

> The overall chain of CLs adds a preview feature to the existing Undo

> functionality. Up until this CL, the browser has the required logic and

> sends the necessary information to the renderer. This CL's goal is to

> first make Undo previewable and second merge the Undo and Fill functions

> in the renderer because they are highly similar.

>

entry.title: Fix hit test update notifications for touch selection in child frames.
entry.content:
In CL:4728431, I modified TouchSelectionControllerClientChildFrame to

recompute selection bounds on hit test updates. However, I mistakenly

put the hit test region update in an if clause for an unrelated screen

rect movement check (which also occurs after an early return where the

selection_controller_client_ probably also should have been updated).



Fix this by moving the selection_controller_client_ update before the

early return.

entry.title: [SAA][Settings] Fix lingering dom elements after reset exception
entry.content:
When a collapsible exception was removed while opened, the iron-collapse

element was left behind and shown on the UI (see video in b:294875621)

if before a static-list-entry (i.e. embargoed entry). Removing

cr-lazy-render fixes the problem, although we cannot pinpoint the reason

why.



This CL substitutes cr-lazy-render by dom-if. We don't expect a

(significant) performance dip since dom-if will only render the element

when the if becomes true for the first time (lazy render), and then

hides the elements on subsequent changes to the if value. This is

similar to how cr-lazy-render along with iron-collapse worked.



Demo of fixed behaviour: http://dr/file/d/1Q-WxRFlGSpMUxY6gu9Qcg2kW0FsbVofw/view



Fixed: b:294875621

Bug: 1433644, 1471396

Change-Id: I72cfe7414b7d5c485c74aef104a14185a852a852

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4758970

entry.title: [iOS] Add Save to Photos service
entry.content:
- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service.h

- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service.mm

The Photos service is responsible for providing a high-level access to

the Photos Library API to implement Save to Photos. It will be created

by a PhotosServiceFactory which will use a provider to return the actual

implementation.

1. ios/chrome/browser/providers/photos/: return an unavailable service

2. ios/chrome/test/providers/photos/: return a fake

3. internally return the actual implementation



- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service_configuration.h

- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service_configuration.mm

This configuration will be used by the provider to configure the service

implementation to be returned.



Fixed: 1471150

Change-Id: Ib70afab1dcc93c81d4a8a35be867a4d196684a02

entry.title: Reland "[sync] Sync test to verify pref from persisted storage is not reset"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 828df79c20c7224a63ccea8594753d2462c92a6d



Usage of SetupSync() was faulty and has been replaced by

AwaitSyncSetupCompletion().



Original change's description:

> [sync] Sync test to verify pref from persisted storage is not reset

>

> This is to verify that once the pref is loaded from the persistent

> storage, it is not reset at any point. As mentioned in the linked bug,

> there was a case where DualLayerUserPrefStore::SetValue() before sync is

> initialized would clear the value from the account store and would get

> re-applied when the pref is loaded from the sync data. This test helps

> verify that such resets won't happen.

>

entry.title: Send SkImage to CanvasAsyncBlobCreator::EncodeImageOnEncoderThread
entry.content:
To encode the image on a worker thread, we currently access the

pixel data via `this->src_data_`. This needs to be eliminated

if we want to stop using CrossThreadPersistent. This CL instead

sends a SkImage reference to the worker thread, which should be

safe, since the underlying bitmap held by SkImage is immutable.

We also send a std::unique_ptr to the worker,

but this is mostly as a way to transport `src_data_`.

(SkPixmap does not have a CrossThreadCopier, so it can't be sent

directly).



As of this CL, there should not be any remaining accesses to `this`,

except for the calls to WrapCrossThreadPersistent(this).



Bug: 1370013

Change-Id: If8c271d14d3103fc745e7b65c9bce39ce7e845f7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4751820

entry.title: Don't keep pointer to popped stack memory for :has()
entry.content:
The sibling_features pass into UpdateFeaturesFromCombinator may be

initialized to last_compound_in_adjacent_chain_features if null. The

outer while loop in

AddFeaturesToInvalidationSetsForLogicalCombinationInHas() could then

reference to the last_compound_in_adjacent_chain_features which is

popped from the stack on every outer iteration. That caused an ASAN

failure for reading stack memory that had been popped.



Instead make sure each inner iteration restarts with the same

sibling_features pointer, which seems to have been the intent here.



Bug: 1470477

Change-Id: I260c93016f8ab0d165e4b29ca1aea810bede5b97

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4759326

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/content_settings/core/browser
entry.content:
The public interface of this target do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.

See [proof].



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

not going to be able to stand alone completely. Its public_config is not

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile some dependents.



[proof]: https://source.chromium.org/search?q=%23include.*base%20file:.h&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc:components%2Fcontent_settings%2Fcore%2Fbrowser%2F



Bug: chromium:1467773

entry.title: Use the normal border color for bubbles with shadows.
entry.content:
The custom with-shadow border color isn't really visible in dark mode,

and it isn't necessary to use a different color than the standard one.

The only distinction the "with shadows" version has is whether to

draw a border at all, which is controlled separately than "what is the

color".

entry.title: Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer
entry.content:
This CL:

-Adds a mojom::AutofillFormAction enum denoting the browser autofill

operation that sent a form to the renderer.

-Adds an ApplyAutofillAction function to form_util with intent to merge

the two deleted functions.

-Adapts FillFormField and PreviewFormField and ClearPreviewedElements

to handle both Fill and Undo operations.

-Fixes typos and clang warnings in touched files



The overall chain of CLs adds a preview feature to the existing Undo

functionality. Up until this CL, the browser has the required logic and

sends the necessary information to the renderer. This CL's goal is to

first make Undo previewable and second merge the Undo and Fill functions

in the renderer because they are highly similar.



Bug: 1441410

Change-Id: Id2ce96d4df2318469a2a2578257040840009e30c

entry.title: Revert "tracing: use default ShmemMode in creating the arbiter"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fffb3dad916cefa609fff763742e0cad9b8d1033.



Reason for revert:

Some MemoryTracingIntegrationTest.* and TracingObserverProtoTest.* tests started failing after this CL



First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25786/overview



Original change's description:

> tracing: use default ShmemMode in creating the arbiter

>

> This CL is a manual roll of perfetto with a fix in Chrome. The perfetto

> upstream introduces the ShmemMode parameter in creating the

> SharedMemoryArbiter in aosp/2627899 and causes breakage in tracing. Fix

> by passing ShmemMode::kDefault (supporting cross-process Shmem) in

> creating the arbiter. Also include a fix of perfetto unittest for

> fuchsia (aosp/2696480).

>

> This CL manually rolls perfetto from 446adf5b7bb4 to 8e8917c609bd

> (36 revisions).

> https://android.googlesource.com/platform/external/perfetto.git/+log/446adf5b7bb4..8e8917c609bd

entry.title: Revert "[X-Device Restore] Fix unexpected omnibox focus on tab switcher"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8910e7d3e2e0860024cdaa9d5fb0f563491e77b4.



Reason for revert: The following bugs - crbug.com/1470967, crbug.com/1470996, crbug.com/1471037, crbug.com/1470986 seem to be caused by the change here.



Bug: 1470967, 1470996, 1471037, 1470986, 1467797



Original change's description:

> [X-Device Restore] Fix unexpected omnibox focus on tab switcher

>

> This CL aims to fix an issue where the omnibox is unexpectedly focused during tab switcher usage, presumably in cases when there is nothing to focus on the screen. A gated if-check will be removed, as the original bug https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1178857 is not visible after this change.

>

> Removing the gated check allows the logic afterwards to properly set the omnibox focus during tab switcher use as well as transitions into and out of the tab switcher.

>

entry.title: [Extensions Cleanup] Move CanShowActionsInToolbar to ToolbarModel
entry.content:
CanShowActionsInToolbar was computed in the extensions container because

that was the only view that needed that value. However,

chrome://extensions also need to know if an extension can be shown

in the toolbar. Therefore, we can move this to the ToolbarModel which

arguably is a better place since we are computing a value for actions.

entry.title: Revert "Cros network service sandbox: Unsandboxed if kerberos is enabled"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5dfa5d11f4e10058d0bafefe754b8126a345233d.



Reason for revert:

SystemNetworkContextManagerNetworkServiceSandboxEnabledBrowsertest.NetworkServiceRestartsUnsandboxedOnKerberosEnabled

is failing on Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan

First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/52807/overview



Original change's description:

> Cros network service sandbox: Unsandboxed if kerberos is enabled

>

> The Linux/cros network service sandbox is incompatible with kerberos.

> So, the network service will start unsandboxed if kerberos is

> enabled, regardless of feature state or enterprise policy.

>

> The KerberosEnabled enterprise policy can change at runtime. If it

> flips to enabled, shut down the network service so it restarts

> unsandboxed. This is not a sandbox hole because only admins

> can enable kerberos.

>

> Change-Id: I4ae1356f31c3f9182a0db803a2ee22ec7bd1744e

> Bug: 1079808

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753004

> Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

> Reviewed-by: Matt Menke

> Commit-Queue: Matthew Denton

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180982}

planned changes in one place:

entry.title: Reland "Make "CreateShortcut" use document title not web app (manifest) title"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2531085825c6e873c8e570a017782f85b1445fc0.



Reason for revert: Reland with fix for mac tests (passed in PS#4).

Note: Patchset #1 is a clean reland so you can see the delta.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Make "CreateShortcut" use document title not web app (manifest) title"

>

> This reverts commit 5872f59bd55b3078c6cd4caedc30ef9e4d1ca780.

>

> Reason for revert: Causing test failures on Mac, see crbug.com/1470663

>

> Original change's description:

> > Make "CreateShortcut" use document title not web app (manifest) title

> >

> > With the "kCreateShortcutIgnoresManifest" flag on, the "Create

> > Shortcut" flow defaults to using the app title found in the web app

> > manifest (if available) rather than the document title. Using the

> > document title is consistent with non-app pages and is more sensible

> > given it is creating a shortcut to the current document, not to the app.

> >

> > Updates affected web app integration test driver function.

> >

> > Bug: 1392652

> > Change-Id: I0d4d993bbf71624a7ead7315cd8fe9d3ee9db82c

entry.title: shortcuts: Fix re-adding custom accelerator does not store in prefs correctly
entry.content:
This fixes a bug in the follow scenario:

1. User add Accelerator_A to Shortcut_A

2. User then adds Accelerator_A to Shortcut_B

3. User re-adds Accelerator_A to Shortcut_A



Step 2 is when the bug would occur in which the prefs associated

with Step 1 are not removed (Step 2 should've removed it due to

conflict resolution).



Adds a new test to catch this scenario.



Bug: b/216049298

Test: ash_unittests

Change-Id: I6689ecbd815e6037a92388ad50886c330dc8daa4

entry.title: [infra] Run all android actions remotely on Siso CQ builders
entry.content:
Some Java actions don't run remotely by default.

This avoids developer builds to get slowdown.

However, builders can benefit from running them remotely.



Android clean build metrics show 2x faster performance.

So it would improve the performance of real CQ builds, too.



Bug: b/284252142, b/277863839

entry.title: Prevent crash when asked to provide an out-of-bounds grid cell
entry.content:
This CL replicates a workaround between the diffable data source

codepath and the original codepath.

The workaround handles a potential case where UIKit asks for a cell at

an invalid index path.



I initially thought that the issue was no longer a problem, otherwise

the DCHECK_LT would have triggered reports, now that DCHECK are hit in

production too. But it seems that this can still happen (cf bug).



I add a DumpWithoutCrashing to both codepaths.



Bug: 1468753

Low-Coverage-Reason: Codepath not hit on CQ (DumpWithoutCrashing)

entry.title: [ssci] Add Shipped field and update NOT_SHIPPED uses
entry.content:
This CL adds the Shipped field to README files. See the LSC

doc at go/lsc-chrome-metadata. Any uses of NOT_SHIPPED are also removed.



These files were originally missed in the main LSC effort due to:

* NOT_SHIPPED was in the Description field (harmless but updated anyway)

* Casing of field was off ("License file" instead of "License File")

* //third_party/node/README.chromium has multiple packages' metadata, so only the first package's metadata had been updated in the initial effort

* not a README.chromium file (README_GardinerMod.txt)

entry.title: Remove incorrect checks in TestGeolocationUrlLoaderFactory.
entry.content:
Latitude/longitude values of 0 are valid. They range from [-90, 90]

and [-180, 180] respectively. Additionally, an accuracy of 0 is

also valid. See Geoposition::Valid() for criteria.



This was caught while making a test suite that exercised a range

of valid latitudes/longitudes, and some of them happened to use

0 degrees. The test failed unexpectedly when it should really

pass.

entry.title: [Extensions] Remove a data member from ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter.
entry.content:
This is one in a series of CLs that will move data out of the

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter that is not keyed by BrowserContext.

This will allow for a more straightforward approach when breaking it

up into multiple per-BrowserContext instances.



This class has a map of of WebRequestRulesRegistry instances with a

composite key consisting of a pointer to a BrowserContext instance

and an integer key for the webview ID. This key can be decomposed

by having each BrowserContextData instance contain the registries

for that instance, keyed by webview ID.



Bug: 1433136

Change-Id: I2c9aa1a0c1fcc2eb8b5853f3c7998e2126bb5844

entry.title: [Tailored security] Implement saving of retry states
entry.content:
When kTailoredSecurityRetryForSyncUsers is enabled, the

tailored security service will save whether a retry is needed or

not.



1. if Chrome is ended before the original flow or any observer-based

recovery method succeeds, then this state-based recovery method will

try again later because the state will still be RETRY_NEEDED.



2. If any of the flows end up succeeding, the service will update the

state to NO_RETRY_NEEDED, which will prevent the recovery mechanism

from trying again in the future.



Also adds a return for the case where no window was available.



Change-Id: Iac2f72b5f58f6e4021ef4c865a75374baf18478b

Bug: 1466978,1466977

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753765

entry.title: Add user heartbeat event.
entry.content:
Manually enqueue a heartbeat event with EventType::kUser instead of

EventType::kDevice when EncryptedReportingManualTestUserHeartbeatEvent feature is enabled. This is so that we use a user DM token instead

of a device DM token when TAST testing reporting from unmanaged devices (which don't have device DM tokens).

entry.title: ui: Enable passthrough by default on CrOS
entry.content:

as per go/finch-best-practices, we should enable by default on ToT

before marking the Finch as launched.
